_header: From the time that we were bore
Title(s): ‘God send us Pacience in oure Old Age’
_description: ‘God send us Pacience in oure Old Age’ — eight 12-line stanzas

BLHar1706.First Lines: FRom þe tyme þat we were boreOure ȝouþe passeþ fro day to day…
BLHar1706.Last Lines: …In to the blysse þat euer schal beWhan we ben passed oure old age
BLHar1706.Attributed Title: We schulde rede and vse bokes in to þis ende and entente for formys of preysynge and preyynge to god to oure lady seynte marye and to alle þe seyntes þat we myȝte haue by þe forseyd vse of redynge vnderstondynge of god of hys benyfetys of hys lawe of hys seruyce or sume orþer goodly and gostely trowþis or ellys þat we myȝte haue good affeccyon toward god and hys seyntes and hys seruyce to be gendryd and geten (rubric preceding first line, f. 212v)

Lam853.First Lines:
From þe tyme þat we were bornoure ȝouþe
                    passiþ from day to dayAnd age encresiþ moore & mooreSo
                    doiþ it now þe sothe to say…
Lam853.Last Lines:
…Lord ȝeue us grace to þinke on þisAs þou
                    bouȝt us alle upon a tree& þat we may in charite weel passe
                    ouer þis passage& to þe blis þat euer schal
                    beWhanne we ben passid ouer oolde age
Lam853.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Hymns to the Virgin and Christ…and other religious poems.
